bullets.text: U.S. PPI fell 0.1% in August, with services -0.2% and goods +0.1%, easing pipeline inflation ahead of Fed decision.
Investors piled into bonds ahead of the Fed decision, locking elevated yields; strategists see opportunity across duration if inflation keeps easing.
Oracle surged 36%, adding $244B market value, amid reports of an OpenAI cloud deal and booming AI backlog.
Klarna's NYSE debut jumped about 15% after pricing above range, raising $1.4B and signaling revived appetite for fintech IPOs.
Israel struck Houthi targets in Yemen after Qatar incident, signaling willingness to hit regional adversaries and raising Red Sea risk.
Security experts warn of a China-led 'anti-Western alliance' coalescing, potentially reshaping global power alignments and supply chains.
Labor Department watchdog opened a probe into BLS jobs and inflation data collection, raising scrutiny of official U.S. statistics.
Trump appealed order blocking him from firing Fed Governor Lisa Cook, while Stephen Miran advanced in Senate, stoking central-bank independence debate.
Boeing reached a tentative deal with striking defense workers, potentially averting prolonged disruptions in defense production.
Wells Fargo's CEO warned of more downside for the U.S. economy as lower-income consumers weaken, implying tighter credit and slower growth.
FDA tightened rules on copycat GLP-1 drugs, curbing compounders and reinforcing market power of branded obesity treatments.
Gravitational-wave 'ringdown' measurements delivered clearest confirmation yet of Kerr black holes, bolstering Einstein and Hawking predictions.
